{"step_by_step_thinking": "The apical foramen is the opening at the tip of the root of a tooth. According to Document 1, there is much variation in the size of the apical foramen even for teeth of the same type. Document 7 also mentions that the shape of the apical foramen changes with age and the distance from the foramen to the anatomical apex increases with age. However, none of the documents explicitly state that the size of the apical foramen increases or decreases with age.", "answer_choice": "D. May increase or decrease with age"}
